author: arnetheduck
content: I guess it could happen if the "best" sync contribution differs from the one the client produced in the previous slot - we'd need to take a look at the sync committee message from 2259 that <@543900561460822016> produced

author: lightclient
content: lmk if i can do anything to help

author: parithosh
content:
I have the `--Xmetrics-block-timing-tracking-enabled` flag enabled on teku, I do see that there's a higher than normal number of late arrival of blocks. Would that be related in any way to the sync committee messages issue we see?

e.g:
```
13:23:44.295 WARN  - Late Block Import *** Block: 6f086ebd1d70d0d675d92759bfaf633fb54c45570d67a50ef32439b28cbb2c7e (7018) proposer 1166 arrival 8285ms, pre-state_retrieved +3ms, processed +6ms, transaction_prepared +0ms, transaction_committed +1ms, completed +0ms
13:24:08.328 WARN  - Late Block Import *** Block: 9024fb14028aac4138493126e2b849eb30d0214ff7ddbca4df37e0c2e911a523 (7020) proposer 1137 arrival 8318ms, pre-state_retrieved +3ms, processed +6ms, transaction_prepared +0ms, transaction_committed +0ms, completed +1ms
13:25:20.290 WARN  - Late Block Import *** Block: cf0a2e9b1f00e91c57b22a6724de2c837b618be78b8250642215f52642e31976 (7026) proposer 1126 arrival 8281ms, pre-state_retrieved +3ms, processed +5ms, transaction_prepared +0ms, transaction_committed +0ms, completed +1ms
```

^ 3 late slots within 10 slots. This isn't a regular thing, I see it sporadically in the logs, yet to find a pattern/link anywhere.

author: parithosh
content: ^ Ah well, I guess the most obvious pattern is that they all belong to the same trache. Proposer 1126,1137 & 1166 are all validator keys run by <@543900561460822016>

author: jgm
content: <@543900561460822016> curious as to your setup.  Are you running on particularly low-powered hardware, or have constricted bandwidth?  Would be interesting to understand what's going on here.
